details.title: Bhuvi opens bowling
details.content: Bhuvneshwar Kumar opens the bowling, gives away four runs.

details.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar Strikes!
details.content: Liton Das top edges a Bhuvneshwar Kumar bouncer to Kedar Jadhav at fine leg.

details.title: Second wicket falls
details.content: Nazmul Hossain Shanto edges a short of length delivery from Bumrah to Shikhar Dhawan at first slip.

details.title: Chahal comes into attack
details.content: Yuzvendra Chahal comes into attack in the ninth over.

details.title: Jadeja to bowl the tenth over
details.content: Ravindra Jadeja comes into attack.

details.title: Dead ball
details.content: Drama unfolds on the pitch over an umpiring decision by Ahsan Raza

details.title: Wicket: Jadeja takes Shakib
details.content: Shakib Al Hasan miscues a sweep off Jadeja. Shikhar Dhawan takes an easy catch at backward square leg.

details.title: Harsha Tweets!
details.content:
Once again Bangladesh need their two key players to score big. Once again, the openers have gone early. Excellent from Bhuvi and Bumrah. Now for the spinners.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) September 21, 2018

details.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar celebrates with Ambati Rayudu
A mix of chinaman and left-arm orthodox
details.content: India is attacking with left arm spinners from both ends. Kuldeep Yadav bowls chinaman while Jadeja is a left-arm orthodox bowler

details.title: Jadeja Strikes Again!
details.content: Jadeja picks up his second wicket. He traps Mushfiqur Rahim lbw with a straight delivery.

details.title: Mushfiqur survives
details.content: Mushfiqur Rahim survives a close stumping call.

details.title: Ravindra Jadeja celebrates the second wicket
Wicket: Jadeja picks up his third scalp
details.content: Mushfiqur Rahim fails at reverse sweeping a delivery from Jadeja. He holes out to Yuzvendra Chahal at short third man.
Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim, left, plays a reverse sweep before he was caught out by India's Yuzvendra Chahal. (Photo | AP)

Triple strike @imjadeja on fire 🔥🔥🔥 #TeamIndia #INDvBAN #AsiaCup2018 pic.twitter.com/R7ZqP5ZitF

— BCCI (@BCCI) September 21, 2018

details.title: Sloppy Chahal!
details.content: Yuzvendra Chahal is having a bad outing on the field. Having dropped a catch, he has given away some runs on the field.

details.title: Wicket: Unlucky Mahmudullah departs
details.content: Mahmudullah is trapped lbw off Bhuvneshwar Kumar. There was an inside edge before the ball hit the pads but Bangladesh have run out of reviews.

details.title: Jadeja on fire!
details.content: Ravindra Jadeja grabs his fourth wicket. Mosaddek Hossain edges to MS Dhoni.

details.title: Harsha on Jadeja
details.content:
Five full bowlers. Always makes a difference. Now, if Jadeja can become a regular no 7, India will have the balance I have been asking for, for so long.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) September 21, 2018

details.title: Sixer!
details.content: Loose delivery from Chahal punished by Mehidy Hasan. Bangladesh 128/7 after 40 overs.

details.title: Partnership building for Bangladesh
details.content: Mehidy Hasan and Mashrafe Mortaza are trying to rebuild Bangladeshi innings with 44 runs unbroken partnership.
Bangladesh's Mehidy Hasan, left, bats during the one day international cricket match of Asia Cup between India and Bangladesh in Dubai. (Photo | AP)

details.title: Bangladesh reach 150
details.content: Bangladesh tail battles on as they reach 150 runs in the 45th over. Mehidy Hasan is leading the charge with 40 runs.

details.title: Bhuvi Strikes!
details.content: Mashrafe Mortaza hit two consecutive sixes but couldn't clear the infield this time around. Caught by Bumrah off Bhuvneshwar.

Bit of a sting in the tail for Bangladesh. But needed many more to be competitive. At least this partnership (Mehidy and Mashrafe) got a move on

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) September 21, 2018

details.title: Bumrah Strikes!
details.content: Mehidy Hasan departs after a well made 42. Slower ball from Bumrah, Mehidy swings. Finds Shikhar Dhawan on the field, who takes a simple catch and celebrates with his trademark Gabbar thigh-five.

details.title: Bangladesh all out for 173
details.content: Bumrah takes his third wicket as Bangladesh are bowled out for 173 runs. Mehidy Hasan top-scored for Bangladesh with 42 runs. Ravindra Jadeja was pick of the bowlers, returning with figures of 4/29.
Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan open the innings for India

details.title: Bangladesh captain punished
details.content: Dhawan scores back to back boundaries of Mashrafe Mortaza. India 15/0 after 3 overs

details.title: First six of the innings
details.content: Dhawan pulls Mustafizur Rahman away to fetch a maximum. India 27/0 after 5 overs.
Another boundary for Shikhar Dhawan. India moves to 47/0 in 8.4 overs

details.title: Fifty up for India
details.content: The opening partnership now stands at 51 runs off 60 deliveries

details.title: Bowling change for Bangladesh
details.content: The tigers bring in the ever-dependable Shakib Al Hasan to break the dangerous-looking opening stand.

details.title: Ruthless Dhawan in top-gear!
Wicket!
details.content: Shakib breaks the opening partnership. Dangerous Dhawan dismissed for 40 of 47 deliveries. India 61/1 after 14.2 overs.
Ambati Rayudu is India's one-down batsman.

details.title: Six!
details.content: Rohit Sharma hammers Shakib Al Hasan to fetch his first six of the innings, moves to 28 off 42 balls.
Bangladesh's Shakib Al Hasan celebrates with teammates the dismissal of India's Shikhar Dhawan | AP

details.title: Drinks
details.content: India 79/1 after 19 overs. 95 runs more to win at the required rate of 3.06
After 20 overs, India 89/1

details.title: Bowling change
details.content: Mortaza brings in seamer Rubel Hossain after 20 overs of cricket.

details.title: It is a fifty and a hundred!
details.content: Rohit Sharma bangs another maximum of Shakib to bring up his half-century and 100 runs for India. Men in Blue 105/1 after 23 overs.

details.title: Wicket
details.content: Second Indian batsman dismissed as Rubel Hossain gets Ambati Rayudu (13 off 28) caught behind the wicket. India 106/2 after 24 overs.
MS Dhoni joins Rohit Sharma at the crease

details.title: Back-to-back fifties for the Indian captain
Sixer
details.content: Rohit Sharma cuts himself loose after reaching half century, sends Shakib flying for his third six of the innings.
Rubel Hossain continues for Bangladesh

India coasting. Good match developing in Abu Dhabi. This tournament could do with one.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) September 21, 2018
Dhoni moves to double-digits with a boundary
India requires another 40 off 124 deliveries with 8 wickets in hand.

details.title: Boundary!
details.content: The Indian captain moves into the 70s with a beautiful boundary of Rubel. India 142/2 after 30 overs.

details.title: Free hit
details.content: India just 24 runs away from victory, the Bangladesh skipper gives a way a free hit. MS Dhoni on strike.
Hammered down the ground for four... Typical MSD power!

details.title: Partnership 53 (50)
details.content: The fourth wicket stand between Rohit Sharma and MS Dhoni has now crossed the 50 mark. India 159/2 after 32 overs.
India just 10 runs away from victory with 97 balls in hand

details.title: The finisher is in touch

details.content: Quick running between the wickerts by MSD and Rohit even at this stage

details.title: Wide
details.content: Extras making things even easier for India

Dhoni batting like a breath of fresh air.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) September 21, 2018
India a boundary away from victory, MSD on strike.

details.title: Wicket
details.content: MS Dhoni (33 off 36 balls) falls to Mortaza in an attempt to finsih-off things fast. India 170/3 after 35.3 overs.
Dinesh Karthik is the new bastman in

details.title: Victory!
details.content: India beat Bangladesh by 7 wickets. Captain Rohit Sharma remains unbeaten on 83
Karthik easily nudges a Shakib delivery to the leg-side to complete the victory.
Ravindra Jadeja wins the Man of the Match Award for his brilliant show with the ball
